message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CL 

This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it focuses on multi-task learning in Convolutional Networks, which is a common technique used in computer vision tasks such as object recognition and image classification. It is also likely to belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category as multi-task learning is a popular area of research in machine learning. Additionally, the paper proposes a new sharing unit, which could fall under the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The use of neural networks also suggests that it could belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category. Finally, the paper's focus on recognition tasks could also place it in the Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) sub-category, as natural language processing tasks often involve recognition and classification.
